meanings.definition: Concentrated at or around a center.
meanings.sent1: The centralised market attracted many customers to one location.
meanings.sent2: The centralised power plant efficiently distributed electricity to nearby towns.
meanings.sent3: The centralised party planning made sure all guests had a great time in one place.
meanings.sent4: Her centralised focus on the main goal helped her achieve success.
meanings.sent5: The centralised traffic flow made navigation through the city much easier.

meanings.definition: Controlled from a single point or source.
meanings.sent1: The centralised decision-making process streamlined operations for the company.
meanings.sent2: The centralised management style ensured consistency across all departments.
meanings.sent3: The centralised cookie jar control prevented any late-night snacking.
meanings.sent4: His centralised leadership kept the team united and focused on the task.
meanings.sent5: The centralised security system protected the building from unauthorized access.
